title: Even as a half-German Remainer, I rather liked Michael Gove's speech – despite the bum note
text:
Oh dear. Are we incapable of agreeing about anything nowadays? What was supposed to be a celebratory evening at the German Embassy has instead ended in a bitter row over a speech given by Michael Gove.

The occasion was the Day of German Unity, which marks the anniversary of German reunification eleven months after the fall of the Berlin Wall. To celebrate this peaceful revolution, the German Embassy in London throws a big party every year including lots of hearty Germanic grub washed down with lots of delicious German beer.

I always go and invariably have a splendid time, although not every year is as eventful or as controversial as this one.

When Mr Gove made his speech (a paean of praise of...
